candidates.name: David Hannay
candidates.why_elect: I have been working within community groups against council for 24 years, this experience has taught me that things desperately need to change in our council to ensure authentic consultation with our community. Grassroots groups need to be cherished not destroyed. Council control of management must be addressed.
candidates.why_stand: I am standing to try and change the management and ethos at council, from a neoliberalist model back to one which values community at its heart.

candidates.name: Chris Tremain
candidates.why_elect: I bring experience, energy and empathy to the table. I have significant experience as a Cabinet Minister, Board Chair, and business owner. I have excellent links to central government, across the House, and around the country. I provide new leadership capable of taking our city forward to a bright future.
candidates.why_stand: I love Napier City more than any other. I want to continue to give back to her by leading the city to a vibrant future where our children and grandchildren want to stay or return. The city needs strong leadership to unify the council and to move forward.

candidates.name: Kirsten Wise
candidates.why_elect: I have many years experience in leadership roles and I understand local council processes. I've Chaired the Finance Committee but most importantly I've been listening to the community, I know what the issues are and I'm not afraid to make a stand on behalf of the community.
candidates.why_stand: I'm running for Mayor because our people need their voice back. I am constantly being told by people they do not feel listened to and there is a massive disconnect between the community and council. Representing the community is at the heart of everything I do.
